title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-4.9 - Number and location of samples required
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 56-4.9 - Number and location of samples required

State Regulations

The amount of ACM, PACM or asbestos material to be abated
within the regulated abatement work area determines the asbestos project air
sampling requirements for that specific regulated abatement work area. (a) Phase I B background pre-abatement air
samples. Required for large and small asbestos projects. (See section
56-4.12, Table 2 of this Subpart
and Subpart 56-6 of this Part.)
(b) Phase II A regulated abatement work area preparation air samples. Required for
large asbestos projects with OSHA Class I or OSHA Class II friable ACM subject
to handling/abatement. (See section
56-4.12, Table 2 of this Subpart
and Subpart 56-7 of this Part.)
(c) Phase II B asbestos handling air samples. Required for large asbestos projects. (See section
56-4.12, Table 2 of this Subpart
and Subpart 56-8 of this Part.)
(d) Phase II C final cleaning and clearance air samples. Required for large, small
and some minor asbestos projects. (See section
56-4.12, Table 2 of this Subpart
and Subpart 56-9 of this Part.)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
56-4.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
